intro: Paraquilegia gangotriana, commonly known as the Gangotri poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Indian Himalayas. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
